framework: DSV (Deconstruct, Synthesize, and Verify) - Ablation Version
input_sentence: if Ego vehicle in front of other vehicle then it must not brake suddenly without a compelling reason.

atomic_propositions.description: Ego vehicle is in front of other vehicle
There is a compelling reason for braking

temporal_relations.description: If ego is in front of other vehicle, then it must not brake suddenly without a compelling reason

lexicon.ego_in_front: Ego vehicle is in front of other vehicle
lexicon.compelling_reason: There is a compelling reason for braking

stage_results.agent_response:
Reasoning Process:
1. Parse objects list to build ID→name mapping:
   - obj_ego → ego
   - obj_other → other

2. Construct atomic propositions in predicate(object) format:
   - ap_1: in_front_of(ego,other) [binary predicate with related_object]
   - ap_2: sudden_braking(ego) [unary predicate, no related_object]
   - ap_3: compelling_reason(ego) [unary predicate, no related_object]

3. Analyze temporal relation: implication type with antecedent "ego_in_front" and consequent "~sudden_brake | compelling_reason"
   - Map to: in_front_of(ego,other) -> (~sudden_braking(ego) | compelling_reason(ego))

4. Apply global property "Always": Wrap the implication with G operator

Final MTL Formula:
G(in_front_of(ego,other) -> (~sudden_braking(ego) | compelling_reason(ego)))

synthesis_result.synthesis_reasoning:
1. Parse objects list to build ID→name mapping:
   - obj_ego → ego
   - obj_other → other

2. Construct atomic propositions in predicate(object) format:
   - ap_1: in_front_of(ego,other) [binary predicate with related_object]
   - ap_2: sudden_braking(ego) [unary predicate, no related_object]
   - ap_3: compelling_reason(ego) [unary predicate, no related_object]

3. Analyze temporal relation: implication type with antecedent "ego_in_front" and consequent "~sudden_brake | compelling_reason"
   - Map to: in_front_of(ego,other) -> (~sudden_braking(ego) | compelling_reason(ego))

4. Apply global property "Always": Wrap the implication with G operator

stage_results.agent_response:
Reasoning Process:
- The formula uses the global operator `G`, meaning "always" or "at all times"
- The main structure is an implication `->` between `in_front_of(ego,other)` and `(~sudden_braking(ego) | compelling_reason(ego))`
- `in_front_of(ego,other)` translates to "the ego vehicle is in front of the other vehicle"
- `sudden_braking(ego)` translates to "the ego vehicle brakes suddenly"
- `compelling_reason(ego)` translates to "there is a compelling reason for the ego vehicle to brake"
- The disjunction `|` with negation `~` means "either not sudden braking OR there is a compelling reason"
- The implication means "if the ego vehicle is in front of the other vehicle, then it must either not brake suddenly OR have a compelling reason"

Natural Language Translation:
At all times, if the ego vehicle is in front of the other vehicle, then either the ego vehicle does not brake suddenly or there is a compelling reason for the ego vehicle to brake.

verification_result.back_translation: At all times, if the ego vehicle is in front of the other vehicle, then either the ego vehicle does not brake suddenly or there is a compelling reason for the ego vehicle to brake.
verification_result.verification_reasoning:
- The formula uses the global operator `G`, meaning "always" or "at all times"
- The main structure is an implication `->` between `in_front_of(ego,other)` and `(~sudden_braking(ego) | compelling_reason(ego))`
- `in_front_of(ego,other)` translates to "the ego vehicle is in front of the other vehicle"
- `sudden_braking(ego)` translates to "the ego vehicle brakes suddenly"
- `compelling_reason(ego)` translates to "there is a compelling reason for the ego vehicle to brake"
- The disjunction `|` with negation `~` means "either not sudden braking OR there is a compelling reason"
- The implication means "if the ego vehicle is in front of the other vehicle, then it must either not brake suddenly OR have a compelling reason"

analyst.name: Analyst_Agent
analyst.description: Responsible for deconstructing natural language into structured semantic components

synthesizer.name: Synthesizer_Agent
synthesizer.description: Responsible for synthesizing syntactically correct MTL formulas from semantic components

verifier.name: Verifier_Agent
verifier.description: Responsible for verifying the semantic correctness of MTL formulas through back-translation
